intro: Oxalis lilacina, commonly known as the purple wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive purple tinge and produces small, delicate flowers in shades of pink and white. The plant belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its ability to thrive in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms. Oxalis lilacina is also noted for its ability to grow in partial shade and is relatively low maintenance.
